results.content: Excellent intro to GCP,git and GitHub
This course exceeded my expectation, all the topics and exercises were of great value and were worth it, I hope to put it into practice soon
results.content_html: This course exceeded my expectation, all the topics and exercises were of great value and were worth it, I hope to put it into practice soon

results.content: Very superficial, with a little lack of explanation on the implementation. Straight forward, without even exploring a little the APIs. The order of "What was learned" must be "MD", "Git" and then GCF. For me, at least, it's ok because I was looking on a kick-off, but for whoever wants to really UNDERSTAND Google Cloud Functions, that's not the course to go for.
results.content_html: Very superficial, with a little lack of explanation on the implementation. Straight forward, without even exploring a little the APIs. The order of "What was learned" must be "MD", "Git" and then GCF. results.content: I liked the comprehensive approach taken, and benefited from seeing how you'd manage your repo when building cloud functions like this.

results.content: A very good intro into cloud functions, practical, engaging, and following a real-world pipeline, excellent for beginners. However, the concepts were not so thoroughly explained and there is more material yet to be covered, ie how to create data from the request and save to db, other ways to secure functions etc
results.content_html: A very good intro into cloud functions, practical, engaging, and following a real-world pipeline, excellent for beginners. However, the concepts were not so thoroughly explained and there is more material yet to be covered, ie how to create data from the request and save to db, other ways to secure functions etc

results.content: Light on content and underlying framework. Needs more information pertaining to possible issues that may arise. But i guess course is new so until user add issues they will not be added.

response.content: Thanks for your feedback. RIght! There are lots of issues that can arise. If you could tell me an example, I'll add it to the content.
